title: The First-Person Narrator
description: An introduction to understanding how first-person narration shapes a story.

what.text: A narrator who tells the story from their own point of view using the first grammatical person.
It provides subjectivity, emotional closeness, and limits the information to what the narrator knows or perceives.

why: It allows for a more direct connection with the reader, conveys emotions, and creates an intimate perspective.

tips: Decide if the narrator is the protagonist or a witness.
Avoid overusing 'I' to not sound repetitive.
exercises: Write an everyday scene (going to the supermarket, taking the subway) from the point of view of a first-person narrator.
Rewrite that same scene in the third person and compare the effect.

examples.text: ‘I will never forget the first time I saw the city…'
